definition: to hold/to embrace/to wrap around/to gather around (sb)/to throng/to swarm/to support/Taiwan pr. [yong3]
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)

sentences.english: Please obey the rules, NOT to crowd or play around when you are touring.
sentences.chinese: 参观游览时，请遵守秩序，不要拥挤打闹。

sentences.english: Alleviating air traffic congestion is one of the major goals of the new push into high-speed rail.
sentences.chinese: 推动高铁发展的主要目的，就是缓解空中交通的拥挤。

sentences.english: Small rooms are no longer crowded.
The crowded continent is full of beautiful architecture and perse cultures.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的大洲充满美丽的建筑和文化。

sentences.english: And there may simply not be enough space in our  crowded cities.
sentences.chinese: 又或许这只是因为我们拥挤的城市没有足够的空间。

sentences.english: Above, a congested street in Lagos sprawls to the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 上图为拉各斯一条拥挤的街道向地平线延展。

sentences.english: If the space feels cramped, a glass coffee table can help make it seem larger.
sentences.chinese: 如果空间拥挤，放张玻璃咖啡桌能显得宽敞些。

sentences.english: Some day the earth will be too crowded for people to live in.
sentences.chinese: 将来地球太拥挤了，人们就无法在地球上很好地生活。

sentences.english: Almost the entire burden was thrown onto the crowded sections of middle and southern England.
sentences.chinese: 几乎全部重荷都放在英国南部和中部的拥挤区域。

sentences.english: But, what if the bike lanes then become congested?
sentences.chinese: 但是，自行车道要是变得拥挤那怎么办？

sentences.english: When the blind girl got on the crowded bus, the passengers made room for her.
sentences.chinese: 那盲女上了拥挤的公共汽车，乘客们给她让出了地方。

sentences.english: In crowded places the police should not discharge their weapons.
sentences.chinese: 在拥挤的地方警察不应击发武器。

sentences.english: That makes it extremely maneuverable in tight, crowded quarters.
sentences.chinese: 那使得它在紧迫又拥挤的小区城市中，极端容易操作。

sentences.english: The streets are heavy with traffic at this time of day.
sentences.chinese: 每天这个时候街道上的交通都很拥挤。

sentences.english: You know I hate the crowded and clamorous cities.
sentences.chinese: 你知道我很讨厌拥挤而且吵闹的城市。

sentences.english: "There were vases being broken and people climbing over other people and a lot of screaming," Bieber fan Taylor Inder told the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 到处都有花瓶被砸碎，人们相互拥挤着并大声尖叫。

definition: to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
stream of people/abortion/abbr. for 人工流產|人工流产[ren2 gong1 liu2 chan3]
crowded to bursting point/filled to overflowing/jam-packed
